intro: Psilocarphus elatior, commonly known as the greater psilocarphus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, spicy scent. It is typically found in moist, woodland habitats and is not widely cultivated due to its limited distribution.
